name: cf-click
description: An extention to jump to cf files in a single click

items.description: Find the text containing a linked file (regex). First captured group is used

^.+$.description: Which other links to include for this languageId (array of: strings or find/filePath object)

items.description: If string, first capturing group is used

find.description: Find the text containing a linked file (regex)

filePath.description: Modify the linked file path found, use any capture group from 'find' regex. Use "/" as first character to signal that file path is relative to a fileroot path

lineNr.description: To which line number do you want to jump, use any capture group from 'find' regex and/or an expression using current position in the file. No default

lineSearch.description: To which line do you want to jump, search for the literal string, use any capture group from 'find' regex. No default

charPos.description: To which character position do you want to jump, use any capture group from 'find' regex and/or an expression using current position in the file. Only used when `lineNr` is defined. No default

rangeGroup.description: The capture group that is the range for the "Follow link". Use $n notation. Default: if no 'lineNr' specified uses capture group from 'filePath'.

isAbsolutePath.description: Is the result of 'filePath' an absolute path. default: false

label.description: The label used in the view, use any capture group from 'find' regex. default: file path

documentLink.description: Create a document link for this find. default: true

allowCurrentFile.description: Is a link to the current file allowed. Used in Table of Content views. default: false

cf-click.exclude.description: Which links to exclude (regexs, a match is enough)

cf-click.fileroot.description: Root directories for the sites in this workspace folder

cf-click.removePathFromLabel.description: Remove the file path from the label. Path shown twice if lineNr's or absolute paths.

cf-click.enableLogging.description: Show a few log statements when clicked on a row or opening a file. Used for debugging.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
